intro: Gynochthodes deplanchei, commonly known as the rock fig, is a succulent shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Moraceae and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are typically consumed by various bird species. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky outcrops. Due to its adaptability and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in regions with a Mediterranean climate.
